Description: Tondo sherd of Attic black-figured pottery cup, possibly a Siana cup; outside glazed, with traces of handle root at top; interior: two bands serving as tondo border; in tondo, black-figure decoration consisting of lion (part of head, mane with added red and one foreleg remaining); to left uncertain object, perhaps Herakles' club - with the Nemean lion in stand-up fight.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Greco-Roman Museum, Alexandria. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1988 / Greek Painted Pottery from Naukratis in Egyptian Museums (p. 88 no. 295 pl. 66)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 379, no. B528, pl. XXVII, pl. CXCI)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1325) (phase 3)
